title: AFN national chief says fast-tracked projects bill should come with plan for infrastructure for reserves
description: Cindy Woodhouse Nepinak said Carney government needs to present a plan for how to get more infrastructure built on First Nations under Bill C-5

title: Canada's minister of health is an unknown to most, but Liberals call her the 'godmother'
description: Marjorie Michel never wanted to run for office. And yet, here she is, succeeding Justin Trudeau as the MP for Papineau.

title: Measles outbreak can be traced to Trudeau politicizing COVID vaccines, Tory MP claims
description: Michelle Rempel Garner said the downplaying of 'rare but serious' side effects spurred broader vaccine hesitancy, including for measles

title: Ontario students targeted by hundreds of antisemitic incidents, federal report finds
description: The survey drew on the testimonies of nearly 600 Jewish parents across the province who reported 781 antisemitic incidents between the Hamas attacks and January 2025

title: TikTok CEO requests urgent meeting with Joly on Canadian shutdown order
description: CEO Shou Chew said the company would soon have to fire more than 350 employees in Canada, stop its direct investment in Canada and cut support for Canadian creators and culture.

title: 'Breach of trust': Critics slam Ottawa's vaccine injury program 'failure'
description: A Global News investigation uncovered complaints against the federal government's support program for Canadians who suffered vaccine injuries.

title: U.K. singer arrested in U.S. after being denied entry into Canada. She overstayed her visa by 26 years
description: Jane Eugene, who was in the British R&B band Loose Ends, was denied an immigrant petition for alien workers in the U.S. in 1999, per Homeland Security

title: Ford government moving to expand privately run, publicly funded surgeries | Globalnews.ca
description: The move comes on the heels of licences for 57 privately operated MRI, CT scan and endoscopy clinics last week and the expansion of for-profit cataract centres in the province.

title: Climate change driving rise in tick-borne illnesses such as Lyme disease | Globalnews.ca
description: A warming climate is driving a rise in Lyme disease and the introduction of lesser-known tick-borne diseases, public health specialists say.

title: Man in Toronto arrested for allegedly urinating on the front steps of a place of worship, shouting antisemitic slurs: police
description: On June 4 a suspect allegedly urinated on the front steps of a place of worship while shouting antisemitic slurs.

title: Canada adds surprise 83,000 jobs in June, driving unemployment rate down to 6.9%
description: Statistics Canada says the unemployment rate dropped a tick to 6.9 per cent in June as the economy added 83,000 jobs, mostly in part-time work.

title: Rogers Stadium opening: Free TTC and GO rides after concerts
description: Concertgoers are being encouraged to use public transit to visit the newly built mega-venue, as concerns over traffic and congestion loom.

title: 'We have to get that balance right': Liberal MPs express worries about major projects bill
description: Liberal MP Nathaniel Erskine-Smith said this week his government's actions would make former prime minister Stephen Harper 'blush.'

title: Health Canada won't fight Alberta's plan to charge for COVID vaccines
description: Starting this fall, most of Alberta's 4.8 million residents will need to pay out of pocket for COVID vaccines, if they choose to get them
